classes.name: ChannelConf
classes.description: A channel configuration class to add, set, delete repo events config from channels

methods.name: init
methods.description: Inits the channel configuration by getting database rows and setting them to `channelconf` variable

methods.name: add
methods.description: Add a channel's webhooks repo thingy

params.name: channel_id
params.description: The channel id for the repo's webhooks

params.name: repo
params.description: The repo's full name, i.e. hydrabolt/discord.js

methods.name: get
methods.description: Get all the channels for a specific repo

params.name: repo
params.description: The repo's full name to look up

methods.name: destroy
methods.description: Delete a spefic channel's repo configuration

params.name: channel_id
params.description: The channel id for which to delete the info

methods.name: array
methods.description:
Creates an ordered array of the values of this collection, and caches it internally. The array will only be
reconstructed if an item is added to or removed from the collection, or if you add/remove elements on the array.

methods.name: keyArray
methods.description:
Creates an ordered array of the keys of this collection, and caches it internally. The array will only be
reconstructed if an item is added to or removed from the collection, or if you add/remove elements on the array.

methods.name: first
methods.description: Returns the first item in this collection.

methods.name: firstKey
methods.description: Returns the first key in this collection.

methods.name: last
methods.description:
Returns the last item in this collection. This is a relatively slow operation,
since an array copy of the values must be made to find the last element.

methods.name: lastKey
methods.description:
Returns the last key in this collection. This is a relatively slow operation,
since an array copy of the keys must be made to find the last element.

methods.name: random
methods.description:
Returns a random item from this collection. This is a relatively slow operation,
since an array copy of the values must be made to find a random element.

methods.name: randomKey
methods.description:
Returns a random key from this collection. This is a relatively slow operation,
since an array copy of the keys must be made to find a random element.

methods.name: findAll
methods.description: Returns an array of items where `item[prop] === value` of the collection

params.name: prop
params.description: The property to test against

params.name: value
params.description: The expected value

methods.name: find
methods.description:
Returns a single item where `item[prop] === value`, or the given function returns `true`.
In the latter case, this is identical to
[Array.find()](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Array/find).

params.name: propOrFn
params.description: The property to test against, or the function to test with

params.name: value
params.description: The expected value - only applicable and required if using a property for the first argument

methods.name: findKey
methods.description:
Returns the key of the item where `item[prop] === value`, or the given function returns `true`.
In the latter case, this is identical to
[Array.findIndex()](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Array/findIndex).

params.name: propOrFn
params.description: The property to test against, or the function to test with

params.name: value
params.description: The expected value - only applicable and required if using a property for the first argument

methods.name: exists
methods.description: Returns true if the collection has an item where `item[prop] === value`

params.name: prop
params.description: The property to test against

params.name: value
params.description: The expected value

methods.name: filter
methods.description:
Identical to
[Array.filter()](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Array/filter),
but returns a Collection instead of an Array.

params.name: fn
params.description: Function used to test (should return a boolean)

params.name: thisArg
params.description: Value to use as `this` when executing function

methods.name: map
methods.description:
Identical to
[Array.map()](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Array/map).

params.name: fn
params.description: Function that produces an element of the new array, taking three arguments

params.name: thisArg
params.description: Value to use as `this` when executing function

methods.name: some
methods.description:
Identical to
[Array.some()](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Array/some).

params.name: fn
params.description: Function used to test (should return a boolean)

params.name: thisArg
params.description: Value to use as `this` when executing function

methods.name: every
methods.description:
Identical to
[Array.every()](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Array/every).

params.name: fn
params.description: Function used to test (should return a boolean)

params.name: thisArg
params.description: Value to use as `this` when executing function

methods.name: reduce
methods.description:
Identical to
[Array.reduce()](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Array/reduce).

params.name: fn
params.description: Function used to reduce

params.name: startVal
params.description: The starting value

methods.name: concat
methods.description: Combines this collection with others into a new collection. None of the source collections are modified.

params.name: collections
params.description: Collections to merge

methods.name: deleteAll
methods.description:
If the items in this collection have a delete method (e.g. messages), invoke
the delete method. Returns an array of promises

classes.name: Logger
classes.description:
A Logger to replace `console.log`.
It logs to the console, web, AND LogDNA

general.name: Welcome
general.data: [![Discord](https://discordapp.com/api/guilds/231548941492027393/embed.png)](https://discord.gg/HHqndMG) [![David](https://img.shields.io/david/datitisev/DiscordBot-Yappy.svg?maxAge=2592000)](https://david-dm.org/datitisev/DiscordBot-Yappy) Yappy monitors your Github repos and pushes events to one or multiple Discord channel(s)! # Welcome! Welcome to the discord.js v9 documentation. The v9 rewrite has taken a lot of time, but it should be much more stable and performant than previous versions. ## Usage ... to be written ... ## Help If you don't understand something in the documentation, you are experiencing problems, or you just need a gentle nudge in the right direction, please don't hesitate to join our official [Yappy Server](https://discord.gg/HHqndMG).

general.name: FAQ
general.data:
# Frequently Asked Questions
These are just questions that get asked frequently, that usually have a common resolution.
If you have issues not listed here, please ask in the [Official Yappy Server](https://discord.gg/HHqndMG).

## I set up a Github webhook pointing to the website, but I don't see any events on the channel
Say `G! init <repo>` on the channel where you want the events.
`repo` can be a Github url or `username/repo`

## I added a webhook to the channel where I get events, but Yappy isn't using it
The Discord webhook must include "Yappy" or "Github" in its name.
Yappy must also have "Manage Webhooks" permission in that channel
